alert.note: Alert for Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Huerfano; Rio Grande; Saguache (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 22 at 10:54AM MST until February 22 at 11:45AM MST by NWS Pueblo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pueblo has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Alamosa County in southeastern Colorado... West central Huerfano County in southeastern Colorado... Rio Grande County in south central Colorado... Southeastern Saguache County in central Colorado... Costilla County in south central Colorado... Conejos County in south central Colorado... * Until 1145 AM MST. * At 1053 AM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located 7 miles north of Capulin, or 15 miles west of Alamosa, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and visibility rapidly falling to less than one-quarter mile. Wind gusts greater than 50 mph could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. Highway 285 and Highway 160 will be affected. Locations impacted include... Alamosa, Monte Vista, Center, Del Norte, Manassa, Sanford, La Jara, Antonito, San Luis, Saguache, Romeo, South Fork, Blanca, Hooper, Great Sand Dunes, Capulin, San Pablo, Alamosa East, Mesita and La Garita. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Consider avoiding or delaying travel until the snow squall passes your location. If you must travel, use extra caution and allow extra time. Rapid changes in visibility and slick road conditions may lead to accidents. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED

area.areaDesc: Alamosa; Conejos; Costilla; Huerfano; Rio Grande; Saguache
